news_header: French President Macron announced a new European AI strategy at an AI summit in Paris, emphasizing France's commitment to AI development and investment.
news_original_title: Macron says France will apply 'Notre Dame strategy' on AI
news_text: On the opening day of an AI summit in Paris co-hosted by India, French President Emmanuel Macron announced that a European AI strategy would be unveiled the next day. He emphasized France's commitment to AI development and called on attendees to choose Europe for their business needs. Macron highlighted plans for a €109 billion investment in AI and France's status as Europe's largest nuclear power producer, which makes it ideal for AI industry demands. The summit features high-profile attendees, including Google CEO Sundar Pichai and OpenAI's Sam Altman.
